pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:11.1: It is hard to make out from the Pali what the announcement is about. The crucial word _appaṭisaṃviditaṃ_ can be read as an adjective qualifying _khādanīyaṃ_ and _bhojanīyaṃ_, in which case it is the food that needs to be announced. Alternatively, it can be regarded as an independent sentence verb, in which case it would seem that it is the risky and dangerous nature of the dwellings that needs to be announced. The word commentary in part supports the former interpretation, whereas the origin story supports the latter. Given this uncertainty, I have opted to translate according to what seems to make the best sense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:12.2: The text reads “five hundred bow-lengths,” _pañcadhanusatikaṃ_. One bow length, according to SED, is equivalent to four _hatthas_ (s.v. _dhanu_), or four forearm’s lengths, sometimes rendered as “cubits.” Following the suggestion in BMC I, pp. 565-566, one forearm is approximately 50 centimeters, which means five hundred bow-lengths add up to about one kilometer.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pd4:17.2: That is, a monk, a nun, a trainee nun, a novice monk, or a novice nun; see {Sp.2.573}: _pañcasu sahadhammikesu_.
